Settings

Saving and Loading

The default scheme for saving settings are yaml file. This allows easy editing via a text editor.

{% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

print_settings[source]

print_settings(settings)

Print a yaml settings file

{% endraw %} {% raw %}

load_settings[source]

load_settings(path)

Load a yaml settings file

{% endraw %} {% raw %}

save_settings[source]

save_settings(settings, path)

Save a yaml settings file to path

{% endraw %}

Settings Template

The settings template defines individual settings. The idea is to provide a template so that a graphical user interface can be automatically generated.

Each entry has a type, default values, and a description.

  • spinbox -> QSpinBox with minimum and maximum values (int)
  • doublespinbox -> QDoubleSpinBox with minimum and maximum values (float)
  • path -> Clickable button to select a path
  • combobox -> QComboBox, dropdown menu with values to choose from
  • checkbox -> QCheckBox, checkbox that can be selected
  • checkgroup -> Creates a list of QCheckBox options that can be selected
